page.title: 14Government & Law and Order.
page.content: The status of Lundy is somewhat unusual and former owners,especially Mr.Harman,fought hard to retain their freedoms.Gradually though it is accepting more outside help and authority.Expensive repairs to the Beach Road in 1978 received help from both the Torridge District Council and Devon County Council. The island falls within the South Devon constituency but there is no polling station and all the residents are granted a postal vote. Crime doesn't seem to pose much of a problem.The only recent offence was over 4 years ago when some day trippers off the paddle steamer were involved in a theft from one of the letting properties. Licensing laws do not apply to the Tavern but recently opening times have been regularised for convenience.
